intro: Hieraciodes comosa, commonly known as the hairy leaf hieracium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features wiry, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. Hieraciodes comosa is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
